components.children: The style of the trench coat has changed little for a hundred years. Such classic clothing is considered by many to be a smart investment because it lasts for a very long time. The owner of a classic trench coat can be sure that his raincoat will never become outdated. While it can be a very expensive purchase indeed, it would be hard to find anyone who would trade in their raincoat after it has served them well for decades.
In short - the best option is 100% cotton gabardine. Today, 100% gabardine can only be found in trench coats of the most expensive class or when made to order - its cost is impractical for mass sale.
The most traditional colors are sand and khaki (dusty earthy shades ranging from dirty yellow to greenish brown). But today, trench coats come in all colors. At least black or dark blue or red.

components.children: The most original option is 10 buttons (5x2). Although it is very difficult to call a single-breasted trench coat a classic, it can still be chosen as an alternative. Single-breasted сoats are especially recommended for short men; the double-breasted variety tends to swallow the petite man up. The double-breasted design also adds an extra layer of wind protection and extra warmth to the trench coat.
